description.narrative: The Project is expected to result in increased capacity of digital infrastructure, with a potential to improve quality of digital connectivity and services for individuals and businesses. These outcomes would be achieved by supporting the sharing of broadband and data infrastructure and adding new international connectivity and data center capacity across a number of countries, including some with substantial gaps in digital connectivity. Beyond the Project, this investment has the potential to result in increased competitiveness of the market for digital connectivity and data across the target countries, by creating competitive markets via demonstration and replication channels.

The proposed project consists of an equity investment of up to US$ 25 million in Convergence Partners Digital Infrastructure Fund (the Fund or CPDIF), a digital infrastructure investment vehicle focused on sub-Saharan Africa (SSA), seeking $250 million in third party commitments and to comprise two parallel funds in South Africa and Mauritius. The funds strategy is to invest in companies operating in the digital technology sector and ICT infrastructure with a geographical focus on Nigeria, Ghana, Cote dIvoire, the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), Ethiopia, South Africa, Kenya, Uganda, Zambia, Tanzania, Mozambique, Botswana.
